meanings.definition: An object surviving from an earlier time, especially one of historical or sentimental interest.
meanings.sent1: The relique of the ancient civilization was carefully displayed in the museum.
meanings.sent2: She treasured the relique of her grandmother's wedding ring.
meanings.sent3: The relique of the old typewriter seemed to have a magical aura around it.
meanings.sent4: The relique of the past whispered stories of bygone eras.
meanings.sent5: The relique gleamed with the memories of a distant past.

meanings.definition: To regard or treat as sacred.
meanings.sent1: The villagers relique the ancient tree that stands in the center of the town.
meanings.sent2: She reliques the family heirloom passed down through generations.
meanings.sent3: The children relique the secret hideout in the woods as their special place.
meanings.sent4: He reliques the moments spent with his best friend as the most precious in his life.
meanings.sent5: The artist reliques the brush that created his masterpiece painting.
